intro: Chionohebe glabra, commonly known as the smooth chionohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
